result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:40 PM Defendant appears in person. Attorney Dylan Resch appears via Zoom. Alex Seifert appears in person for State of Wisconsin. ADA Seifert- Pre lim will be waived. Attny Resch- reviewed document. Waiving freely intelligently and voluntarily. Pleading not guilty. Bond forfeited on august 3rd on 22CF125. Attny Resch- makes statement. Defendant- makes statement. Date mixed up for hearing that was missed. Attny Resch- 3 other pending cases. Forfeit $500. Feb 3 2023 for trial on all cases. Adj 2:50 PM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:22 AM Defendant Scott A Matt in court.  Attorney Dylan J Resch appeared by video for Scott A Matt.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Resch and Matt have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH and will waive time limits  for that, will probably file a waiver of PH. Court considers  time limits waived, sets for PH on 9/2822 at 2:45 PM, set 22CF125 for BBR on same date as well.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol.

9:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott A Matt in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Dylan J Resch not in court. State - here on RWIN/AIA. Court reviews file, Attorney filed a request to appear via Zoom, will wait a few minutes to see if he calls in. Clerk informs Court that Mr. Matt said off the record that he did not think his attorney was available today and was going to ask for a new date. Court will get another date, will address failure to appear when his attorney appears, sets bond at $750.00 cash with same conditions of no consumption of alcohol, sets for 9/14/22 at 10:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott A Matt not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. State asks for forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant, body or $750.00. Court so orders.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott A Matt in court. Matt has received a copy of the complaint. Court advises of charges and penalties. Matt understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Matt has contacted an attorney, Rick Cveykus. State believes Cveykus is on his other cases, possible global resolution or a new attorney would be assigned. State - bond has been set. Court continues bond and has set for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
